intro: Hieracium fronditerum, commonly known as the fronded hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lobed leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in the summer months. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. It is a perennial species that spreads through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some habitats.
